title: PPFD Meter | Plant Grow Light Meter | LUX DLI

container.value: Sun Plaza Bilim Sk. No:5a Kat:19 Maslak Sarıyer İstanbul

creator: Home Studio Inc.
descriptionHtml:
PPFD Meter uses the phone's built-in ambient light sensor to collect LUX information. If you don't have a good one, you can also use a UNI-T UT383 BT with Bluetooth.

UNI-T performs superior to any built-in sensor we have tested. We are not partners with UNI-T. It's just one of the best LUX meter with Bluetooth connection having a price tag lower than 20 bucks.

Whichever sensor is used during the measurement, PPFD Meter converts LUX into PAR and calculates PPFD and DLI simultaneously in a sleek UI. You can also record your measurements and view them on a graph.

As a source selection, we only provide general conversions.
We are also working hard to provide specific conversions for popular grow lights. Until then you must select the best option which describes your lights.

Here is an example to help on this goal:
If you are using a quantum board build with 3k and 5k diodes,
choose 4k, if the 3k diode count is equal to 5k ones.
choose 3.5k, if the count of 3k diodes twice as many as 5k ones.

On top, if your board has 660nm go one level warmer.
choose 3.5k, if the 3k diode count is equal to 5k ones and you have 660nm.
choose 3k, if the count of 3k diodes twice as many as 5k ones and you have 660nm.

Do you also UV (below 400nm) & FR (above 700nm) diodes?
These ranges are not truly detectable without special hardware, close them if you can. If you can not, just ignore them.
descriptionShort: We worked hard and made simple and elegant PPFD meter without additonal sensors!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: We have updated our information screens. They are much more detailed now.

PPFD Meter uses the phone's built-in ambient light sensor to collect LUX information. If you don't have a good one, you can also use a UNI-T UT383 BT with Bluetooth.

UNI-T performs superior to any built-in sensor we have tested. We are not partners with UNI-T. It's just one of the best LUX meter with Bluetooth connection having a price tag lower than 20 bucks.

Whichever sensor is used during the measurement, PPFD Meter converts LUX into PAR and calculates PPFD and DLI simultaneously in a sleek UI. You can also record your measurements and view them on a graph.

As a source selection, we only provide general conversions.
We are also working hard to provide specific conversions for popular grow lights. Until then you must select the best option which describes your lights.

Here is an example to help on this goal:
If you are using a quantum board build with 3k and 5k diodes,
choose 4k, if the 3k diode count is equal to 5k ones.
choose 3.5k, if the count of 3k diodes twice as many as 5k ones.

On top, if your board has 660nm go one level warmer.
choose 3.5k, if the 3k diode count is equal to 5k ones and you have 660nm.
choose 3k, if the count of 3k diodes twice as many as 5k ones and you have 660nm.

Do you also UV (below 400nm) & FR (above 700nm) diodes?
These ranges are not truly detectable without special hardware, close them if you can. If you can not, just ignore them.
descriptionShort: We worked hard and made simple and elegant PPFD meter without additonal sensors!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: Improvements & bug fixes.

title: PPFD Meter | Plant Grow Light Meter | LUX DLI

creator: Home Studio Inc.
descriptionHtml:
The PPFD Meter uses the phone's built-in ambient light sensor (ALS) to collect information on each photon that hits the plant canopy.

You can also use a Bluetooth sensor. We support seamless integration with UNI-T UT383 BT over Bluetooth Low Energy.

If this sounds overwhelming, don't worry! We have prepared for your onboarding. You will find lots of useful information inside our guides. So, you can get the best out of PPFD Meter.

The only PAR Meter you need is to adjust your lights optimally.

Good to know that UNI-T performs superior to the most built-in sensors we have tested. We are not partners with UNI-T. It's just one of the best LUX meters with Bluetooth LE connection having a price tag lower than 20 bucks. Hard to beat that for a low-cost solution.

No matter which sensor is used during the measurements, PPFD Meter converts LUX readings from the sensor into PAR and calculates PPFD and DLI simultaneously in a sleek UI. You can customize the animations inside the displays for your needs.

You can also record all your measurements and view them on a time graph later. This is continent when you try to find out MIN/MAX values over an area.

We have also released the PAR Map feature where you can create your PAR Maps for your own grow area! When you are done taking the measurements. We will prepare a beautiful Screenshot for you! They are perfect to reference later when you adjust your lights.

If you want to try the PAR Map, you can set random values. This is built for you. So, you will know what it will look like after your journey.
descriptionShort: Simple yet elegant PAR meter that just works with or without additonal sensors!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Hey Grower,
Now you can create your own PAR MAP with PPFD METER!
Check it out under PPFD & DLI
Happy Growing!

The PPFD Meter uses the phone's built-in ambient light sensor (ALS) to collect information on each photon that hits the plant canopy.

You can also use a Bluetooth sensor. We support seamless integration with UNI-T UT383 BT over Bluetooth Low Energy.

If this sounds overwhelming, don't worry! We have prepared for your onboarding. You will find lots of useful information inside our guides. So, you can get the best out of PPFD Meter.

The only PAR Meter you need is to adjust your lights optimally.

Good to know that UNI-T performs superior to the most built-in sensors we have tested. We are not partners with UNI-T. It's just one of the best LUX meters with Bluetooth LE connection having a price tag lower than 20 bucks. Hard to beat that for a low-cost solution.

No matter which sensor is used during the measurements, PPFD Meter converts LUX readings from the sensor into PAR and calculates PPFD and DLI simultaneously in a sleek UI. You can customize the animations inside the displays for your needs.

You can also record all your measurements and view them on a time graph later. This is continent when you try to find out MIN/MAX values over an area.

We have also released the PAR Map feature where you can create your PAR Maps for your own grow area! When you are done taking the measurements. We will prepare a beautiful Screenshot for you! They are perfect to reference later when you adjust your lights.

If you want to try the PAR Map, you can set random values. This is built for you. So, you will know what it will look like after your journey.
descriptionShort: Simple yet elegant PAR Meter that just works with or without additonal sensors!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
We have added MIN MAX AVG trackers to all displays.
They will record respective values for 60 minutes.
If you want to reset them just use volume buttons.
Performance improvements.
Happy Growing!

title:
PPFD Meter - Grow Light Meter
10.01

creator: Home Studio Inc.
descriptionHtml:
Welcome to the world of advanced plant care with PPFD Meter, the app that turns your smartphone into a sophisticated tool for optimizing plant growth. Perfect for both seasoned gardeners and beginners, PPFD Meter sets itself apart from standard grow light meter apps with its comprehensive features and intuitive design.

Using your phone's built-in ambient light sensor or the acclaimed UNI-T UT383 BT sensor via Bluetooth, PPFD Meter provides precise and reliable light measurements. This accuracy is essential for understanding and optimizing the light your plants receive, ensuring their health and growth.

PPFD Meter is more than a light measurement tool; it's a guide to understanding your plants' needs. It converts LUX readings into PPFD (Photosynthetic Photon Flux Density) and DLI (Daily Light Integral), providing critical insights for your lighting setup. Customize up to five different settings profiles for various environments or growth stages, making your plant care as unique as your garden.

Advanced Light Mapping and Analysis

Step into a new era of light management with PPFD Meter's advanced light mapping capabilities. Our exclusive PAR and DLI Maps feature offers a vivid, detailed representation of light distribution across your grow area, enabling precise adjustments for optimal plant growth.

In-Depth Light Analysis: Measure light uniformity to ensure even plant growth, and evaluate your setup's PPF (Photosynthetic Photon Flux) to understand the total light output.

Comprehensive DLI Tracking: Monitor the Daily Light Integral, a key factor in regulating plant health and growth cycles, ensuring your plants receive the right amount of light each day.

These advanced features make PPFD Meter not just an app, but a vital partner in your indoor gardening journey. It’s a leap forward from typical grow light meter apps, offering a depth of analysis and customization that truly enhances your plant care experience.

Download PPFD Meter today and embark on a journey of precision and expertise in plant care. Your plants will thrive like never before!

Perfect for both seasoned gardeners and beginners, PPFD Meter sets itself apart from standard grow light meter apps with its comprehensive features and intuitive design.

Using your phone's built-in ambient light sensor or the acclaimed UNI-T UT383 BT sensor via Bluetooth, PPFD Meter provides precise and reliable light measurements. This accuracy is essential for understanding and optimizing the light your plants receive, ensuring their health and growth.

PPFD Meter is more than a light measurement tool; it's a guide to understanding your plants' needs. It converts LUX readings into PPFD (Photosynthetic Photon Flux Density) and DLI (Daily Light Integral), providing critical insights for your lighting setup. Customize up to five different settings profiles for various environments or growth stages, making your plant care as unique as your garden.

Advanced Light Mapping and Analysis

Step into a new era of light management with PPFD Meter's advanced light mapping capabilities. Our exclusive PAR and DLI Maps feature offers a vivid, detailed representation of light distribution across your grow area, enabling precise adjustments for optimal plant growth.

But that's just the beginning:

In-Depth Light Analysis: Measure light uniformity to ensure even plant growth, and evaluate your setup's PPF (Photosynthetic Photon Flux) to understand the total light output.

Comprehensive DLI Tracking: Monitor the Daily Light Integral, a key factor in regulating plant health and growth cycles, ensuring your plants receive the right amount of light each day.

These advanced features make PPFD Meter not just an app, but a vital partner in your indoor gardening journey. It’s a leap forward from typical grow light meter apps, offering a depth of analysis and customization that truly enhances your plant care experience.
